page.title: 20INTERVIEW-continued
page.content: would not affect her children. However she is very anxious about her eldest child.He is just about to begin his secondary schooling.She has fears about the school itself and regrets the lack of choice available, transport by the local authority is only provided for this one school.This she realises is one of the drawbacks of living in the country.In general terms she is unhappy with the comprehensive system of education and would prefer the old segregated system of grammar and secondary modern schools. Her future has its uncertainties, the farm her husband works on is to be sold which could necessitate they're looking for another place.She seemed confident of they're finding one.
